form.name: food_variety_two
form.page_subtitle: CWC Counselling: Feeding A Healthy Child > Food Variety TWO

field.name: Counsel mother/caregiver types of foods/meals to include

Adequate quantities of thick koko made of maize (akasa), millet, sorghum, guinea corn or rice; ekwegbemi; or other thick porridges like tombrown and weanimix with sugar AND enriched with one or more of the following:
Palm oil, shea butter or other vegetable oils, ground paste, soya flour, bean flour, egg, milk, or fish powder
For children ≥ 12 months or older, porridge should be served with bread, bofrot, koose, maasa, kulikuli, or biscuit
Give fruits every day such as pawpaw, banana, pear, orange, pineapple mango or watermelon
Give snacks in between main meals such as bofrot, koose, maasa, bread, kulikuli, biscuit, doughnuts, egg, roasted or fried plantain or yam
